# Orion Advisor Tech

## Overview
- **Website:** https://orionadvisortech.com
- **Category:** Portfolio Management, Reporting, and Rebalancing Platform
- **Description:** Orion Advisor Tech is a comprehensive wealth management technology platform offering portfolio management, performance reporting, trading and rebalancing, billing, client portal, and integrations with major custodians and financial technology providers. Founded in 1999, headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska.
- **Status:** Active
- **Last Updated:** 2026-02-12

## Pricing Tiers

Orion does not publicly disclose specific pricing on their website. Pricing is custom-quoted based on firm AUM, number of accounts, and specific service needs.

### Platform Fee Structure
| Tier | Platform Fee | Advisor Fee Capability | Notes |
|------|--------------|------------------------|-------|
| Standard | 0.25% - 0.50% of AUM | Up to 150 bps total | Base platform fee for custody and technology |
| Custom | Negotiable | Up to 150 bps total | Based on AUM volume and firm size |

### Fee Breakdown Components
1. **Orion Platform Fee:** 25-50 bps (0.25%-0.50%) - charged on AUM
2. **Advisor Advisory Fee:** Set by advisor, up to 100 bps additional (total 150 bps)
3. **ETF Expenses:** Passed through from underlying ETFs

### Pricing Model Notes
- **Custom pricing only** - no public pricing on website
- **No minimums** for basic accounts
- **No setup fees** for standard implementation
- **No transaction costs** for most transactions
- **Fee collection:** Both platform and advisory fees drawn from client accounts
- **Volume discounts:** Available for larger firms
- **Enterprise pricing:** Available for RIAs, broker-dealers, family offices

### Consumer Pricing Reference (for context)
Orion's consumer-facing services show:
- **Basic Platform:** Custom AUM-based pricing
- **Enterprise Platform:** Custom pricing based on firm needs
- **Minimum AUM:** Typically $50M+ for full platform access

### Advisor-Specific Financial Requirements
- **Minimum AUM:** No strict minimum for basic services
- **Minimum Client Count:** No minimum
- **Implementation Fees:** Varies by complexity

## Key Features

### Core Capabilities (All Plans)

#### Portfolio Management & Performance Reporting
- **Portfolio Analytics:** Comprehensive performance reporting with GIPS compliance
- **Client Reporting:** Customizable reports with branding options
- **Benchmarking:** Multiple benchmark options for performance comparison
- **Asset Allocation:** Tools for strategic and tactical allocation
- **Performance Attribution:** Detailed attribution analysis
- **Tax-Loss Harvesting:** Automated tax optimization

#### Trading & Rebalancing
- **Quantum Rebalancer:** Advanced rebalancing engine
- **Trade Optimization:** Tax-aware trading decisions
- **Model Management:** Customizable investment models
- **Automated Trading:** Systematic trade generation
- **Direct Indexing:** Tax-efficient investing options
- **FIX Integration:** Direct connection to custodians

#### Billing & Operations
- **Fee Calculation:** Multiple fee structures supported
- **Automated Invoicing:** Scheduled billing and invoicing
- **Custom Reporting:** Detailed billing reports
- **Asset Exclusion:** Ability to exclude assets from fee calculation

#### Client Experience
- **Client Portal:** Branded client experience
- **Mobile App:** iOS and Android applications
- **Document Management:** Secure document storage
- **Secure Messaging:** Encrypted communication
- **Financial Planning Integration:** Links with planning software

### Advanced Features (Tier-Specific)
- **Multi-Custodian Support:** Connect to multiple custodians
- **Enterprise Workflows:** Custom business process automation
- **Advanced Analytics:** Deep portfolio analysis tools

### Enterprise-Only Features

- **Custom Reporting:** Tailored reporting solutions

### Limitations
- **Pricing Transparency:** No public pricing available

## Integration Overview

**Total Integrations:** 50+ major financial technology providers and custodians

### Key Integrations Detailed

#### 1. Charles Schwab
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Real-time data sync, SSO to Schwab Advisor Center, digital account opening, trade submission
- **Data synced:** Account balances, positions, transactions, performance data
- **Setup complexity:** Easy (Schwab approved integration)
- **Limitations:** Requires Schwab custodial account
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/schwab

#### 2. Fidelity Clearing & Custody
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** SSO to Wealthscape, digital account opening, trade integration, reporting
- **Data synced:** Account data, positions, transactions, billing files
- **Setup complexity:** Easy (Fidelity approved)
- **Limitations:** Requires Fidelity custodial account
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/fidelity

#### 3. BNY Mellon Pershing
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** One-way (data in)
- **What it does:** Daily data files, trade files, advisory fee billing files
- **Data synced:** Account data, trade data, billing information
- **Setup complexity:** Medium (requires Pershing setup)
- **Limitations:** Primarily data sync, limited trade execution
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/bnymellon

#### 4. eMoney Advisor
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Account balance and performance data for financial planning, Orion reports in eMoney vault
- **Data synced:** Account data, performance data, planning data
- **Setup complexity:** Medium (requires eMoney account)
- **Limitations:** Both platforms required
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/emoney

#### 5. MoneyGuidePro
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Household/account level data sync for financial plans, pulls financial plan reports into Orion
- **Data synced:** Account data, planning data, plan summaries
- **Setup complexity:** Medium (requires MoneyGuidePro account)
- **Limitations:** Both platforms required
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/moneyguidepro

#### 6. Morningstar ByAllAccounts
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** One-way (data in)
- **What it does:** Account aggregation from 15,000+ financial institutions for performance reporting
- **Data synced:** Aggregated account data, held-away assets
- **Setup complexity:** Medium (aggregator setup)
- **Limitations:** Aggregation only, no trade execution
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/morningstar

#### 7. Redtail CRM
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Data sync for contacts and accounts, Orion features within Redtail (Insight, Eclipse Trading, Reports)
- **Data synced:** Contact records, account data, household data
- **Setup complexity:** Easy (Redtail approved)
- **Limitations:** Requires Redtail CRM account
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/redtail

#### 8. Salesforce
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** Two-way sync, portfolio data in Salesforce, new accounts, transactions
- **Data synced:** Contact data, portfolio data, account data
- **Setup complexity:** Medium (requires Salesforce setup)
- **Limitations:** Requires Salesforce account with API access
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/salesforce

#### 9. BlackRock Advisor Center
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** One-way
- **What it does:** Digital tools for portfolio decisions, client relationships
- **Data synced:** Portfolio data for analysis
- **Setup complexity:** Easy (BlackRock partnership)
- **Limitations:** Research and analysis only
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/blackrock

#### 10. Orion Einstein (AI)
- **Type:** Native Integration
- **Direction:** Bi-directional
- **What it does:** AI-powered portfolio analysis, optimization recommendations
- **Data synced:** Portfolio data for AI analysis
- **Setup complexity:** Easy (built-in feature)
- **Limitations:** Available for Enterprise tier
- **Documentation:** https://orionadvisortech.com/integrations/einstein

## Evaluation Notes

### Pros (5+ items)
1. **Comprehensive platform** - All-in-one wealth management solution
2. **Strong custodian integrations** - Deep integration with major custodians
3. **Advanced rebalancing** - Quantum Rebalancer is powerful
4. **Client portal** - Branded and feature-rich
5. **Multi-custodian support** - Works with multiple custodians
6. **API access** - Full API suite for custom development
7. **Enterprise features** - White-label, advanced analytics

### Cons (4+ items)
1. **No public pricing** - Pricing only available via direct contact
2. **Complex implementation** - May require significant setup time
3. **Cost structure** - AUM-based fees may be high for smaller firms
4. **No free trial** - Requires demo and consultation
5. **Minimum AUM** - Typically $50M+ for full platform
6. **Limited small firm support** - Better suited for larger RIAs

### Alternatives
- **Envestnet** - More comprehensive platform
- **Tamarac** - Strong reporting and trading
- **Black Diamond** - Portfolio management focus
- **Advent Geneva** - Institutional focus
- **Addepar** - More modern interface

### Use Cases

**Ideal For:**
- RIAs with $50M+ AUM
- Firms needing multi-custodian support
- Advisors wanting advanced rebalancing
- Firms needing comprehensive reporting
- Growing RIAs planning to scale

**Not Ideal For:**
- Solo advisors with small AUM
- Firms wanting transparent pricing
- Teams needing simple solutions
- Advisors wanting quick implementation
- Small firms with limited budgets

### Key Differentiators (5 items)
1. **Quantum Rebalancer** - Industry-leading rebalancing engine
2. **Multi-custodian platform** - Works with 10+ custodians
3. **Full API suite** - Extensive integration capabilities
4. **Enterprise features** - White-label, custom reporting
5. **Longevity** - Established 1999, strong track record
